## Institutions in Years

```{r instyear}
df_na <- df_na %>%
  mutate(soc_sec_age = (year - unemp_first_law) + (year - pension_first_law) + (year - labor_workinjury_firstlaw))

# add year for macro
df_macro <- df_macro %>%
  mutate(soc_sec_age = (wave - unemp_first_law) + (wave - pension_first_law) + (wave - labor_workinjury_firstlaw))

df_macro_rog <- df_macro_rog %>%
  mutate(soc_sec_age = (year - unemp_first_law) + (year - pension_first_law) + (year - labor_workinjury_firstlaw))
```

## Adjust for SOCX

The problem with SOCX is that it increases over time, so it is necessary to take a cross-sectional version. Take the mean by country. This is imperfect because it is an unbalanced time-series, but it should be good enough for now. The real problem is within-country change which this solves. It also keeps countries relatively sorted in order of 'size of welfare state'. I also do this for GDP here.

```{r socx_cs}
df_macro <- as.data.frame(df_macro) %>%
  group_by(iso3c) %>% 
  mutate(socx_C = mean(socx),
         gdp_C = mean(gdp_pc_10k)) %>% 
  ungroup()

df_macro_rog <- as.data.frame(df_macro_rog) %>%
  group_by(iso3c) %>% 
  mutate(socx_C = mean(socx)) %>% 
  ungroup()
```

```{r corrs}
# Correlations
cor(dplyr::select(df_macro, gov_redist, liberal_redist_i, socx, socx_C), use = "pairwise.complete.obs")

cor(dplyr::select(df_macro_rog, gint, socx, socx_C), use = "pairwise.complete.obs")

```


```{r socx}

# socx is quite linear w/ gov should redistribute
ggplot(df_macro, aes(y = gov_redist, x = socx)) +
  geom_point()

# socx is somewhat linear w/ inequality is too large
ggplot(df_macro, aes(y = incdiff_large, x = socx)) +
  geom_point()

# socx is quite linear w/ gov intervention scale
ggplot(df_macro_rog, aes(y = gint, x = socx)) +
  geom_point()

# socx is not linear w/ liberal_redist_i
ggplot(df_macro, aes(y = liberal_redist_i, x = socx)) +
  geom_point()

# gdp also linear, but this could include a time trend
ggplot(df_macro, aes(y = gov_redist, x = gdp_pc_10k)) +
  geom_point()

m1 <- lm(gov_redist ~ socx_C, data = df_macro)
m2 <- lm(gint ~ socx_C, data = df_macro_rog)

df_macro <- df_macro %>%
  mutate(gov_redist_socx = predict.lm(m1, newdata = df_macro),
         gov_redist_socx_resid = gov_redist - gov_redist_socx)

df_macro_rog <- df_macro_rog %>%
  mutate(gint_socx = predict.lm(m2, newdata = df_macro_rog),
         gint_socx_resid = gint - gint_socx)


```

### Final Variable Mods

Dummy for former communist
Re-scale for easier regression results
Plot_summs does not standardize the variables properly, so scale them here
```{r fmr_comm}
df_macro <- df_macro %>% 
  mutate(fcomm = ifelse(type_7 == "Former Communist", 1, 0),
         soc_sec_age_100 = soc_sec_age/100,
         w = 6) %>% 
  group_by(iso3c) %>% 
  mutate(groupn = n()) %>% 
  ungroup() %>% 
  mutate(weight = w/groupn)

df_macro_rog <- df_macro_rog %>% 
  mutate(fcomm = ifelse(type_8 == "Former Communist", 1, 0),
         soc_sec_age_100 = soc_sec_age/100,
         w = 6) %>% 
  group_by(iso3c) %>% 
  mutate(groupn = n()) %>% 
  ungroup() %>% 
  mutate(weight = w/groupn)

# count countries, generate weights

```
## Regressions

### Standard

```{r reg}
#without former communist
reg1 <- lm(gov_redist ~ soc_sec_age_100 + socx_C, data = df_macro)
reg2 <- lm(gint ~ soc_sec_age_100 + socx_C, data = df_macro_rog)
reg3 <- lm(liberal_redist_i ~ soc_sec_age_100 + socx_C, data = df_macro)
# standardize
reg1Z <- scale_mod(reg1, scale.response = T)
reg2Z <- scale_mod(reg2, scale.response = T)
reg3Z <- scale_mod(reg3, scale.response = T)
#with
reg4 <- lm(gov_redist ~ soc_sec_age_100 + socx_C + fcomm, data = df_macro)
reg5 <- lm(gint ~ soc_sec_age_100 + socx_C + fcomm, data = df_macro_rog)
reg6 <- lm(liberal_redist_i ~ soc_sec_age_100 + socx_C + fcomm, data = df_macro)
# standardize
reg4Z <- scale_mod(reg4, scale.response = T)
reg5Z <- scale_mod(reg5, scale.response = T)
reg6Z <- scale_mod(reg6, scale.response = T)
```

### Weighted
```{r regw}
#without former communist
reg1w <- lm(gov_redist ~ soc_sec_age_100 + socx_C, data = df_macro, weights = weight)
reg2w <- lm(gint ~ soc_sec_age_100 + socx_C, data = df_macro_rog, weights = weight) 

#no longer used
reg3w <- lm(liberal_redist_i ~ soc_sec_age_100 + socx_C, data = df_macro, weights = weight)

# standardize
reg1wZ <- scale_mod(reg1w, scale.response = T)
reg2wZ <- scale_mod(reg2w, scale.response = T)
reg3wZ <- scale_mod(reg3w, scale.response = T)
#with
reg4w <- lm(gov_redist ~ soc_sec_age_100 + socx_C + fcomm, data = df_macro, weights = weight)
reg5w <- lm(gint ~ soc_sec_age_100 + socx_C + fcomm, data = df_macro_rog, weights = weight)
reg6w <- lm(liberal_redist_i ~ soc_sec_age_100 + socx_C + fcomm, data = df_macro, weights = weight)
# standardize
reg4wZ <- scale_mod(reg4w, scale.response = T)
reg5wZ <- scale_mod(reg5w, scale.response = T)
reg6wZ <- scale_mod(reg6w, scale.response = T)
```
